data.title: Game crashed after joining server
data.body:
Here's the exception log:

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20131223
Operating System: Linux (Unix 3.12.1.64)
Runtime Version: Mono 3.0.6 (Debian 3.0.6+dfsg2-11) CLR 2.0.50727.1433
```

data.title: OpenGL Error: GL_OUT_OF_MEMORY
data.body:
I receive this error quite often. It seems I crash the multiplayer game also I heard from other players.

Yesterdag I updated my videocard drivers (ATI AMD Radeon HD 6670) to the latest version, but it did not solve the problem as the game crash just yet again.

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20131223
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 2.0.50727.5477
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: OpenGL Error: See graphics.log for details.
   bij OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.ErrorHandler.CheckGlError()
   bij OpenRA.Renderer.SdlCommon.Texture.SetData(Byte[] colors, Int32 width, Int32 height)
   bij OpenRA.Graphics.Sheet.get_Texture()
   bij OpenRA.Graphics.SpriteRenderer.Flush()
   bij OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.set_CurrentBatchRenderer(IBatchRenderer value)
   bij OpenRA.Graphics.Renderer.DisableScissor()
   bij OpenRA.Widgets.ScrollPanelWidget.DrawOuter()
   bij OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter()
   bij OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter()
   bij OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter()
   bij OpenRA.Widgets.Widget.DrawOuter()
   bij OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   bij OpenRA.Game.Run()
   bij OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   bij OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

data.title: Splitted LobbyInfo updates into smaller chunks
data.body: as suggested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/4594 to revive https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3162.

data.title: Lots of TS mod fixes & additions
data.body:
As title says.

Original purpose was fixing #5040, but it got a little out of hand ;)
I did some testing and there shouldn't be any crashes, but due to the amount of changes additional testing/reviewing is recommended.

data.title: Another Shroud & FoW discussion.
data.body:
Shroud was discussed in the IRC (again) today.
I think shroud should be disabled by default in the vanilla mods for MP.
FoW would remain enable by default.
SP could still use shroud as to not expose the layout of the map for various reasons.

[Edited to discuss shroud's default setting only]

data.title: Merge FileFormats dll into Game and reorganise namespaces.
data.body:
This unifies Game and FileFormats, and starts reorganizing things. A future cleanup may want to push the sprite and container definitions into the mod dlls, which would allow for modders to define their own loaders without touching the engine.

The justification for this is that a) this split hasn't been relevant for quite some time now (all our tools already linked against Game), and b) Having the Cell and World types in OpenRA.Game would dramatically simplify the lua rewrite.  FieldLoader depends on these types, so it had to come too -> FileSystem needed FieldLoader -> Format parsing code needed FileSystem.  The remaining bits aren't important enough to keep their own dll.

data.title: Check file path for map if previous map hash could not be matched
data.body:
When developing a map (particularly the yaml, not lua) the map's hash changes, so the map needs to be continually found in the map chooser after each edit.

When setting the lobby's initial map, the game checks if the previously played map still exists (by matching the hash). If there's no match, we could also check if the file path to the map still exists, and if so then set that as the initial map.

edit: clarity
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1679378-check-file-path-for-map-if-previous-map-hash-could-not-be-matched?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Singleplayer adds bot on map that disallows bots
data.body:
Reproduce (tested this in RA only):
- Make a lobby, choose a map that disallows bot in the player 2 slot (or all slots).
- Return to main menu
- Click Singleplayer
- Bot is added

data.title: New tabs for the RA mod.
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5108

data.title: New tabs design for RA mod
data.body:
Here is the next step for an updated RA UI, following @MicroGraphics' work : https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5107

Here is the new tabs.png file:
![tabs](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1732773/2710442/7eba8ba2-c4c1-11e3-86c8-e345422733d7.png)

And here is what needs to be modified in chrome.yaml (from line 75 to 122):

```

tabs-selected: tabs.png
    allies-Building: 0,0,28,40
    allies-Defense: 0,40,28,40
    allies-Infantry: 0,80,28,40
    allies-Vehicle: 0,120,28,40
    allies-Plane: 84,160,28,40
    allies-Helicopter: 0,160,28,40
    allies-Ship: 0,200,28,41
    soviet-Building: 84,0,28,40
    soviet-Defense: 84,40,28,40
    soviet-Infantry: 84,80,28,40
    soviet-Vehicle: 84,120,28,40
    soviet-Plane: 84,160,28,40
    soviet-Helicopter: 0,160,28,40
    soviet-Ship: 84,200,28,41

tabs-ready: tabs.png
    allies-Building: 28,0,28,40
    allies-Defense: 28,40,28,40
    allies-Infantry: 28,80,28,40
    allies-Vehicle: 28,120,28,40
    allies-Plane: 112,160,28,40
    allies-Helicopter: 28,160,28,40
    allies-Ship: 28,200,28,41
    soviet-Building: 112,0,28,40
    soviet-Defense: 112,40,28,40
    soviet-Infantry: 112,80,28,40
    soviet-Vehicle: 112,120,28,40
    soviet-Plane: 112,160,28,40
    soviet-Helicopter: 28,160,28,40
    soviet-Ship: 112,200,28,41

tabs-normal: tabs.png
    allies-Building: 56,0,28,40
    allies-Defense: 56,40,28,40
    allies-Infantry: 56,80,28,40
    allies-Vehicle: 56,120,28,40
    allies-Plane: 140,160,28,40

    allies-Ship: 56,200,28,41
    soviet-Building: 140,0,28,40
    soviet-Defense: 140,40,28,40

```

data.title: Fixed dialog.png for RedAlert
Update CHANGELOG
fixed dialog for ra
data.body: fixed the corners for the menu @ ra

data.title: mcv briefly flickers into fact before deployment is complete
data.body: Possibly related to the harvester facing bug. Don't know for sure though.

data.title: D2k Concrete and Building decay
data.body: Could you guys make Concrete and Building decay optional?

data.title: Fix volume slider order in the settings panel.
data.body: Fixes #5088.

data.title: Give engineers attack stance to automatically capture buildings
data.body:
If there are lots of buildings to capture, there is no way to make engineers capture them automatically. There could be a stance where they automatically capture neutral and/or enemy buildings within a radius. This is practically necessary for specialized maps such as "Great Oily Divide" where there are tons of oil derricks that need to be captured.

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/1638062-give-engineers-attack-stance-to-automatically-capture-buildings?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Utility.exe --upgrade-map removes everything which is not map.bin or map.yaml
create a mailllist server
data.body:
Hello.

I think we should create a maillist server. For example, mirrors list is growing quite fast, and it's becoming increasingly difficult to notify all mirrors' owners about something.

I can setup the maillist server (based on mailman), but I need domain-name for it. For example "maillist.open-ra.org".

Related: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAWeb/pull/112

data.title: Permanent bans for users (with reason)
data.body:
I want to ban some users permanently on my servers. They are kicking users without any reason. I don't like that.

data.title: Option to prevent spectators from starting the game
data.body: Its ok if specs wait in the game room, but its not ok if they join the game (when it starts) and crash it or tell secrets about other players like they use to.

data.title: Fixed #3826
Veterancy for non-combat units.
data.body:
Non-combat units should be able to gain veterancy in a way besides crates. Harvesters gain rank for ore deposited at a refinery, engineers for buildings captured, mechanics for repairs done etc.

Maybe a full rank ore truck can carry 25% more ore!? I don't know use your imagination!

data.title: Allow non-hosts to view list of maps
data.body:
A feature suggestion:

Make it possible for non-hosts to view the list/menu of available maps while in the multiplayer game staging area (perhaps to make it easier to choose a common map?)

data.title: Added the Beacon button artwork for Red Alert, Dune 2000 and Tiberian Sun
data.body: thanks to @xanax. This will unhide the button in all other mods. Also fixed some minor annoyances I stumbled upon while testing.

data.title: Fixed harvester husk Z offset on refineries
data.body: as reported in #5087.

data.title: Add RA vehicle explosions
data.body: Fixes #5077.

data.title: Mechanics have no repair cursor for damaged pillboxes
data.body:
Mechanics can repair damaged defense structures and their cursor changes to the wrench symbol when hovered over these buildings. But their cursor doesn't change to wrench on pillboxes. Instead it is the garrison icon. I guess there is no easy way to fix this since there is an ambiguity in possible actions. A mechanic can either repair a pillbox or garrison it, even though it may not have a purpose.

Edit: Just learned that mechanics repairing defense buildings was a bug and that this was fixed. So I closed the issue.

data.title: Enhanced Makefile to clean up after IDE mess
data.body: to also delete those strange sub-folders that MD/VS create and make the build fail.

data.title: Music volume is controlled by video volume slider
data.body: In audio settings menu, the music volume is controlled by the video volume slider and not the one for music. The slider in the music menu works correctly. I tested this on the release 20131223 and not the playtest. This is on linux.
